content.description: The Conn Adventure Climb book says something like "Climb chimney on the north".  Approach from the north side scrambling up to the base which is a grassy gulley between the main eight massif and a separate tower to the north.  Scramble to the top of a block and step across to the south, go up.
content.protection: Good gear to a number 4, a few longer slings for natural features.  A bit runout in a couple sections due to the size of the chimney but very secure.
content.location: North facing chimney on the north side of the eight massif.  Approach from the picket fence side, or climb seven, rap into seven/eight gulley and walk up to the base.

climbs.name: The Hateful Eight
climbs.fa: Chris Hirsch, Joel McKillop, Taylor Lais, Tony Schwartz (Ground-up) 7/16

content.description: Mixed line that climbs the exposed S corner of Spire Eight. Two bolts lead to a short steep crack in the middle that protects well, followed two more bolts to the top. Cozy belay perch.
content.protection: 4 bolts   Single rack to BD #2   Bolted anchor with chain   Single 80m rope needed!
content.location: Locate the Spire Eight mass. Approach from the S. Scramble up rock gully and take first left into another gully, belay here. Start up slab to a flake, first bolt is above this flake.
